Module kivakit.serialization.core
Package com.telenav.kivakit.serialization.core

Interface SerializationSession

All Superinterfaces:
AutoCloseable, com.telenav.kivakit.core.messaging.Broadcaster, Closeable, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.io.Flushable<com.telenav.kivakit.core.time.Duration>, com.telenav.kivakit.core.messaging.Listener, com.telenav.kivakit.core.messaging.MessageTransceiver, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.naming.Nameable, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.naming.Named, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.naming.NamedObject, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.messaging.Receiver, com.telenav.kivakit.core.messaging.Repeater, com.telenav.kivakit.core.messaging.Transceiver, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.messaging.Transmitter, com.telenav.kivakit.core.language.trait.TryCatchTrait, com.telenav.kivakit.core.language.trait.TryTrait, com.telenav.kivakit.core.version.Versioned
public interface SerializationSession extends com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.naming.Named, Closeable, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.io.Flushable<com.telenav.kivakit.core.time.Duration>, com.telenav.kivakit.core.version.Versioned, com.telenav.kivakit.core.messaging.Repeater, com.telenav.kivakit.core.language.trait.TryTrait
A high-level abstraction for serialization. This interface allows the serialization of a sequence of SerializableObjects using an ObjectSerializer during a bracketed session associated with an InputStream or OutputStream. This design provides ease-of-use while ensuring that the stream is always assigned a version and the input or output stream is managed correctly.

Creating a Session

The method SerializationSessionFactory.newSession(Listener) can be called to obtain a SerializationSession instance. Providers of serialization will provide a SerializationSessionFactory that produces thread-safe SerializationSessions. Alternatively a session can be created by constructing an implementation instance.

Opening a Session

A serialization session is initiated by calling:

  • open(InputStream)
  • open(InputStream, SessionType)
  • open(OutputStream, Version)
  • open(OutputStream, SessionType, Version)
  • open(Socket, SessionType, Version, ProgressReporter)
  • open(InputStream, OutputStream, SessionType, Version)

When a SerializationSession.SessionType.CLIENT_SOCKET_SERIALIZATION_SESSION or SerializationSession.SessionType.SERVER_SOCKET_SERIALIZATION_SESSION session is opened, handshaking and exchange for version information will take place.

Reading and Writing

A session will remember any input or output stream that was given to it when the session was opened, so that when read and write methods are called:

  • read() - Read a SerializableObject from input
  • read(Class) - Read an object of the given type from input
  • readList(Class)
  • readResource(Resource, UncheckedVoidCode)
  • write(Object) - Write an object to output
  • write(SerializableObject) - Write a SerializableObject to output
  • writeList(Collection)
  • writeResource(WritableResource, Version, UncheckedVoidCode)

objects will be read and written to the streams passed to open().

Closing a Session

  • close()
  • onClose()

Properties

  • isActive()
  • isReading()
  • isWriting()
  • maximumFlushTime()
    •

    Example

     var session = new KryoSerializationSession();
 var version = session.open(SessionType.RESOURCE, input, output);
 session.write(new SerializedObject<>("hello"));
 session.close();

    jonathanl (shibo)

      • open

        default com.telenav.kivakit.core.version.Version open(Socket socket, SerializationSession.SessionType sessionType, com.telenav.kivakit.core.version.Version version, com.telenav.kivakit.core.progress.ProgressReporter reporter)
        Returns opens the given socket for reading and writing. Version handshaking is performed automatically for SerializationSession.SessionType.SERVER_SOCKET_SERIALIZATION_SESSIONs and SerializationSession.SessionType.CLIENT_SOCKET_SERIALIZATION_SESSIONs with the version of the connected endpoint returned to the caller.

      • read

        default <T> T read(Class<T> type)
        Reads an object of the given type from the input, discarding any version. If the object read from input is not of the given type, an IllegalStateException will be thrown. This method can be used to read primitives, for example: read(Integer.class).
        Parameters:
        type - The type to read
        Returns:
        The object
